intro: Conomorpha panamensis, commonly known as the Panamanian conomorpha, is a species of flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, forested areas and has narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in shades of yellow and brown. Conomorpha panamensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
